rationale: The agent successfully removed the getHighestNumberOfSeenUniqueValues() method from the IndexFieldData interface and AbstractIndexFieldData class, including the associated tracking logic (highestUniqueValuesCount field, updateHighestSeenValuesCount method, and the call in the load method). The agent also correctly removed the delegating implementation in NoOrdinalsStringFieldDataTests. However, the agent went beyond the ground truth by removing similar tracking logic from DocValuesIndexFieldData and its subclasses (SortedSetDVBytesIndexFieldData and SortedSetDVNumericIndexFieldData). While these additional changes are consistent with the task goal and appear correct, they were not part of the ground truth diff, suggesting the human reviewer may have intentionally left those implementations intact or they may not have been necessary. The extra changes in DocValuesIndexFieldData.java show removal of maxUniqueValueCount field, updateMaxUniqueValueCount method, and modifications to load methods in two subclasses. These are logically sound but represent unsolicited work beyond what the ground truth demonstrates. No documentation was added, code style matches existing patterns, and no functionality was broken.
